question: Under which scheme, bank loans between Rs.10 lakh and Rs.1 crore is provided to set up an enterprise to SC/ST or women borrower?
explanation:
Stand Up India Scheme was launched in the year 2016 to promote entrepreneurship among the underserved sector of people such as Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe and Women.
It aims to provide bank loans between Rs.10 lakh and Rs.1 crore to at least one SC or ST borrower and 1 woman borrower per bank branch to set up a greenfield enterprise. As per a recent government data, over 81% of the account holders under the scheme are women.
